They stop, look at each other, hold each other's hands tight. The whole station seems frozen, the only movement from a thousand bodies being Jamal and Latika.
dialogue.speaker: LATIKA
dialogue.context: He shakes his head.
dialogue.utterance: I thought we would meet again only in death.
dialogue.speaker: JAMAL
dialogue.context: Jamal puts his hand on Latika's chin, turns her head gently so that she is facing him. He sees the knife scars on her cheek for the first time. She tries to turn her head, but he won't let her. Runs his hand slowly down the scar. Rests his hand there.
dialogue.speaker: JAMAL
dialogue.context: He gently kisses the scarred cheek.
dialogue.speaker: JAMAL
dialogue.context: The camera pulls back and back, rising above the station. The music starts and the frozen station comes alive, two thousand kurta-clad men and saree-clad women dancing in and out and on top of the trains, an unbound celebration of hope and humanity that has at its centre, Jamal and Latika.
